result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

***07-02-15/ Mel Flanagan***

Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

No drugs or alcohol.

No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Successfully complete  any other counseling and/or treatment  deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Thomas Gramling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Amended JOC reflects 07-02-15 Court ordere for restitution inthe amount of $515.00.

Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statements to the Court.
Court sets Restitution at $515 - payable to Kori G.
Restitution to be paid before payment of the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court instructs defendant to arrange payments with the probation agent.
Clerk:  jms
Per Linda Lembcke, DOC has withdrawn its request to commute the probation term.  DOC will fix the entry in WICS to the original two years.  No further action needed.
DOC request to commute probation term.

Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by: Kori G. 
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Kori G. 
   without prior court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and DNA surcharge supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution Hearing scheduled in Br. 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  
* Today, go and sign up for treatment in Rom 511. 
* Defendant must give DNA test today.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR 4 ON 9-11-2015 at 1:30 pm.  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Statement made by Kori G.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Kori G., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Kori G., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kori G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  
Defendant Daniel Thomas Gramling in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
